intro: Molinaea tolambitou, commonly known as the Tolambitou mole plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and mountainous areas. It has hairy leaves and stems, which help it retain moisture in its native habitat. Molinaea tolambitou is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
